dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Description
dataObjects.title: General Description
dataObjects.description:
From Boulenger, 1909, pp. 270-271

Depth of body 2 3/5 to 3 times in total length, length of head 4 to 5 times. Head as long as deep or a little longer, about twice as long as broad; snout feebly compressed, rounded, strongly projecting beyond mouth; 1/3 to 2/5 length of head, equal to interorbital width; eye 1 1/3 to 1 2/3 times in length of snout, 3½ to 4½ times in length of head; maxillary extending to below nostrils; teeth in two series in each jaw, 20 to 30 in outer series. Dorsal 25-27 (4-5 unbranched), a little nearer head than caudal, its base not twice as long as its distance from adipose fin. Anal 14-16 (3-4 unbranched), its base much shorter than that of anal. Pectoral 3/4 to 5/6 length of head. Caudal forked, upper lobe longer and pointed, lower rounded or obtusely pointed. Caudal peduncle as long as deep or a little longer. Scales 68-78, 13-15 / 14-16, 10-11 between lateral line and root of ventral. Brown, silvery white beneath, with 18 to 20 dark vertical bars; young with a dark brown spot above the pectoral and another at root of caudal; dorsal with small blackish spots.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits rivers, rarely in lakes (Ref. 4967).  Feeds on plants (Ref. 13371).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 0; Dorsal soft rays (total): 23 - 28;  Analspines: 0; Analsoft rays: 13 - 16

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.description: 60.0 cm TL (male/unsexed; (Ref. 7094)); max. published weight: 3,000 g (Ref. 7094)
dataObjects.references: Daget, J. and J.-P. Gosse 1984 Distichodontidae. p. 184-211. In J. Daget, J.-P. Gosse and D.F.E. Thys van den Audenaerde (eds.) Check-list of the freshwater fishes of Africa (CLOFFA). ORSTOM, Paris and MRAC, Tervuren. Vol. 1. (Ref. 7094)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: pelagic; freshwater; pH range: 6.0 - 8.0; dH range: 25

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses
dataObjects.title: Importance
dataObjects.description: fisheries: of no interest; aquarium: public aquariums
